q_text_2020: the global covenant of mayors requires committed cities to report their inventories in the format of the new common reporting framework, to encourage standard reporting of emissions data. please provide a breakdown of your city-wide emissions by sector and sub-sector in the table below. where emissions data is not available, please use the relevant notation keys to explain the reason why.-if you have no emissions occurring outside the city boundary to report as a result of in-city activities, please select a notation key to explain why-ippu > product use

q_text_2021: please provide a breakdown of your ghg emissions by scope. where values are not available, please use the comment field to indicate the reason why.-scope 1 emissions excluding emissions from grid-supplied energy generation-city-wide emissions
q_text_2020: please provide a breakdown of your ghg emissions by scope. where values are not available, please use the comment field to indicate the reason why.-scope 1 emissions excluding emissions from grid-supplied energy generation-city-wide emissions

q_text_2021: please provide details of your total fixed level target(s).-explanation of boundary choice where the assessment boundary differs from the city boundary
q_text_2020: please provide details of your total fixed level target(s).-boundary of target relative to city boundary (reported in 0.1)

q_text_2021: please provide details of your total fixed level target(s).-absolute emissions in year target was set
q_text_2020: please provide details of your total fixed level target(s).-target year absolute emissions goal (metric tonnes co2e)

q_text_2021: please provide details of your total city-wide base year intensity target. an intensity target is usually measured per capita or per unit gdp. if you have an absolute emissions reduction target, please select “base year emissions (absolute) target” in question 5.0.-intensity unit (emissions per)
q_text_2020: please provide details of your total city-wide base year intensity target. an intensity target is usually measured per capita or per unit gdp. if you have an absolute emissions reduction target, please select “base year emissions (absolute) target” in question 5.0.-intensity unit (emissions per)

q_text_2021: please provide details of your total city-wide baseline scenario target(s), including projected business as usual emissions.-please describe your target. if your country has an ndc and your city’s target is less ambitious than the ndc, please explain why.
q_text_2020: please provide details of your total city-wide baseline scenario target(s), including projected business as usual emissions.-please describe your target. if your country has an ndc and your city’s target is less ambitious than the ndc, please explain why.

q_text_2021: describe the anticipated outcomes of the most impactful mitigation actions your city is currently undertaking; the total cost of the action and how much is being funded by the local government.-web link to action website
q_text_2020: describe the anticipated outcomes of the most impactful mitigation actions your city is currently undertaking; the total cost of the action and how much is being funded by the local government.-web link to action website

q_text_2021: has your city measured the wider social and economic impacts of delivering climate actions/projects/policies? if so, please provide more details on which benefits are being measured and/or a link to more information.-has your city measured the distribution of these impacts across the city’s population (e.g. through the listed actions)-response
q_text_2020: has your city measured and demonstrated the wider social and economic impacts of delivering climate actions/projects/policies? if so, please provide more details and a link to more information.-none

q_text_2021: please explain why you do not measure your local government scope 3 emissions and detail your plans to do so in the future, if any.-please explain-please explain
q_text_2020: please explain why you do not measure your local government scope 3 emissions and detail your plans to do so in the future, if any.-please explain-please explain

q_text_2021: please provide details of your renewable energy target(s) and how the city plans to meet those targets.-percentage of target achieved
q_text_2020: please provide details of your renewable energy or electricity target(s) and how the city plans to meet those targets.-percentage of target achieved

q_text_2021: please provide details of your renewable energy target(s) and how the city plans to meet those targets.-percentage renewable energy of total energy in target year
q_text_2020: please provide details of your renewable energy or electricity target(s) and how the city plans to meet those targets.-percentage renewable energy / electricity of total energy or electricity in target year
